result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Called:  2:17 p.m. 
INCLUDES 19CM1823, 20CM1391, 22CF180.
State appears by DA Theresa Wetzsteon and ADA Kyle Mayo.  
Defendant appears in custody from Stanley Correctional by video with Atty Kat Yanke (spec appr). 

Date and time set for attorney review hearing; VRCW.   
Atty Yanke states an attorney has been appointed to these cases, Atty Christopher Zachar. 
Atty Zachar has asked the Court if he can appear by video for hearings that are not evidentiary; Atty Yanke has advised Atty Zachar about the form; COURT has no objection. 

COURT sets PTC/scheduling conference for 7/08/22 at 9:00 a.m.  Court will allow Atty Zachar to appear by phone.

SPD Status of Counsel
Request for Prompt Disposition
Status hearing on June 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called: 10:02 a.m. 
INCLUDES 19CM1823, 20CM1391, 22CF180.
State appears by DA Theresa Wetzsteon.  
Defendant appears in custody from Stanley Correctional by video, pro se. 

Date and time set for attorney review hearing; VRCW.  
COURT recites off record discussions; deft has been told by SPD office and they cannot find counsel despite numerous attempts. 
DA Wetzsteon makes statement; also contacted SPD office.  Concerned re: length of ongoing attempts. 
COURT advises deft re: court appointed attorney.  
Defendant states he wants to find counsel or even court appointed. 
COURT discusses concerns with deft re: severity of charges and appointing counsel who will take his case. 
Defendant makes arguments re: prolonging matters further. 

COURT directs State to set attorney RH immediately after Court today and again orders someone from SPD to appear at hearing. 
DA Wetzsteon will contact SPD office prior to review hearing. 

Adj:  10:12 a.m.
SPD Status of Counsel
to reschedule hearing
Review hearing on June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  1:32 p.m. 
INCLUDES 19CM1823, 20CM1391 and 22CF180.
State appears by DA Theresa Wetzsteon and ADA Kyle Mayo. 
Defendant appears in person in custody from MCJ, pro se. 

Date and time set for attorney review hearing; VRCW. 
COURT questions deft re: counsel and defendant's request for new counsel. 
Defendant wishes to obtain new counsel.  
ADA Mayo makes statement; spoke with SPD office states they are continuing to search for someone but haven't found someone to date. 
Defendant states he is currently being housed in Stanley Correction. 

COURT advises defendant that more time will be given for SPD office to find counsel.  

COURT directs parties to set review hearing with judicial assistant. 
COURT grants defendant to appear by video from Stanley Correction at next hearing; also orders SPD office to appear at hearing if no one has been appointed.

Includes cases 22CF180, 20CM1391, & 19CM1823. No contact with victim(s): N.O.(unless official capacity), and (non-waivable) L.A.I. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety. No driving without a valid license. No possession or use of dangerous weapons.
